pageContext.claim: “General Jim Mattis will be retiring, with distinction, at the end of February, after having served my Administration as Secretary of Defense for the past two years.”
pageContext.analysis: After Trump's tweet about retirement, Mattis released a letter showing that he actually quit in protest over Trump's decision to withdraw troops from Syria and had sharp disagreements with the president on a range of issues. In a letter that offered none of the customary praise of a president, Mattis said that the president should have a Defense Secretary who is “better aligned” with his views.
